intro: Hyssopus cretaceus, commonly known as the Mediterranean hyssop, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. The plant produces spikes of small, blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Hyssopus cretaceus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is valued for its aromatic foliage and has been used historically in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
